test.name: Start Game Application

kw.name: Start Application
kw.doc: Starts the process in the ``command`` parameter on the host operating system. The given ``alias`` is stored to identify the started application in RemoteSwingLibrary.

test.name: Select the main window

kw.name: Select Window
kw.doc: Selects a window as current context and sets focus to it.

test.name: 1A Check if radio button A1 is selected

kw.name: Select From Main Menu
kw.doc: Selects an item from the menu of the window that was opened first. Shortcut for: | `Select Window` | 0 | | `Select From Menu` | Tools|Testing|MyTestTool |

kw.name: Radio Button Should Be Selected
kw.doc: Fails if radiobutton is not selected.
kw.msg:
Start Game! - GAMEEE!!! A1 selected Setting button PANELS to white! White Theme Setting Set!
Setting radio BUTTONS to white! White Theme Setting Set! Resetting all buttons Reset Score~ 0

test.name: 1B All radio buttons shall be visible

kw.name: Component Should Be Visible
kw.doc: Checks that component is visible. Even if one pixel of the component is visible, this keyword will pass.

kw.doc: Checks that component is visible. Even if one pixel of the component is visible, this keyword will pass.

test.name: 1D Score shall be 0

kw.name: Label Text Should Be
kw.doc: Checks the equality of given text and the text displayed on a label. Assumes that the label exists in the current context.

test.name: 2 Exit window when clicked submenu

kw.name: Ensure Application Should Close
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword and waits until timeout for the application to close. If the application doesn't close, the keyword will take a screenshot and close the application and after that it will fail. In many cases calling the keyword that will close the application under test brakes the remote connection. This exception is ignored as it is expected by this keyword. Other exceptions will fail this keyword as expected.

kw.name: Select From Main Menu
kw.doc: Selects an item from the menu of the window that was opened first. Shortcut for: | `Select Window` | 0 | | `Select From Menu` | Tools|Testing|MyTestTool |

test.name: 3 Pop up dialog should appear when user selects Options->Theme

kw.name: Start Application
kw.doc: Starts the process in the ``command`` parameter on the host operating system. The given ``alias`` is stored to identify the started application in RemoteSwingLibrary.

kw.name: Select Window
kw.doc: Selects a window as current context and sets focus to it.

kw.name: Select From Menu And Wait
kw.doc: Selects an item from the menu of the currently selected window and waits for action to finish. This keyword will not work, for example, if the menu item opens a dialog.

test.name: 3A The title of the dialog should be Theme

kw.name: Dialog Should Be Open
kw.doc: Fails if the dialog is not open.

kw.name: Select Dialog
kw.doc: Selects a dialog as current context and sets focus to it.

test.name: 3B There should be a combobox with the options Light and Dark

kw.name: Get Combobox Values
kw.doc: Returns a list containing all the values of a combobox.
kw.msg: org.netbeans.jemmy.TimeoutExpiredException: Wait for "themeOptions" subcomponent to be displayed

kw.name: Should Contain
kw.doc: Fails if ``container`` does not contain ``item`` one or more times.

kw.name: Should Contain
kw.doc: Fails if ``container`` does not contain ``item`` one or more times.

kw.name: Close Dialog
kw.doc: Closes a dialog.

test.status: org.netbeans.jemmy.TimeoutExpiredException: Wait for "themeOptions" subcomponent to be displayed

kw.doc: Selects a window as current context and sets focus to it.

kw.doc: Selects an item from the menu of the currently selected window and waits for action to finish. This keyword will not work, for example, if the menu item opens a dialog.

kw.doc: Fails if the dialog is not open.

test.name: 6B. The content as The user shall reach the end of the maze by using the arrow controls or mouse clicks.

kw.doc: Fails if component does not exist within current context. You might want to set the waiting timeout with the keyword `Set Jemmy Timeout`
